titleStmt.title: The theatre of the world in the which is discoursed at large the many miseries and frailties incident to mankinde in this mortall life : with a discourse of the excellency and dignity of mankinde, all illustrated and adorned with choice stories taken out of both Christian and heathen authors ... / being a work of that famous French writer, Peter Bovistau Launay, in three distinct books ; formerly translated into Spanish by Baltazar Peres del Castillo ; and now into English by Francis Farrer ...
Theatrum mundi. English
titleStmt.author: Boaistuau, Pierre, d. 1566.

titleStmt.title: The theatre of the world in the which is discoursed at large the many miseries and frailties incident to mankinde in this mortall life : with a discourse of the excellency and dignity of mankinde, all illustrated and adorned with choice stories taken out of both Christian and heathen authors ... / being a work of that famous French writer, Peter Bovistau Launay, in three distinct books ; formerly translated into Spanish by Baltazar Peres del Castillo ; and now into English by Francis Farrer ...
Theatrum mundi. English
titleStmt.author: Boaistuau, Pierre, d. 1566.
Farrer, Francis.

notesStmt.note: The second pt. has special t.p. with title: A short discourse of the excellency and dignity of man.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
